H0.text: Heat energy is what a light bulb also transforms electrical energy into, in addition to light energy.

H1.text: Potential energy is the energy form that a light bulb transforms electrical energy into, in addition to light energy.

H2.text: Magnetic energy is a form into which a light bulb also transforms electrical energy, in addition to converting electrical energy into light energy.

H3.text: Mechanical energy is the form of energy that a light bulb transforms electrical energy into, in addition to light energy.

A4.text: Less than 5% of the energy they consume is converted into visible light; the rest is released as heat.

A5.text: The useful part of the emitted energy is visible light, but most energy is given off as heat in the near-infrared wavelengths.
